content:
The have vs let linter was just merged into mathlib. It should flag incomplete proof where a have is used to introduce a non-Prop valued assumption. By default, the linter will only emit its warning if

  • the proof is incomplete;
  • there are no errors.

The typical use-case is a proof with sorrys filling in some missing proofs.

Being the author of the linter, I think that this is an improvement, but I can also see that it might be distracting: please do report issues that you might have with the linter! I tried to make it "as quiet as possible": if a proof works with a have that introduces a Type-valued hypothesis, the linter will not say anything.
There is also a lean#3559 tracking this issue: reports on the linter may also inform decisions on that issue.
